title: RabbitMQ Overview (Management Version)
description:
## RabbitMQ Integration

This dashboard provides an overview of your RabbitMQ (Management plugin) environment. It monitors node status, provides information on message statuses, and gives you insight into various other observability measures of your RMQ setup. 

*Note:* If you are using the Prometheus plugin version of RabbitMQ, use the alternate dashboard.

For more information, refer to:
* [RabbitMQ Integration Doc](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/rabbitmq/?tab=host)
* [RabbitMQ Blog by Datadog](https://www.datadoghq.com/blog/monitoring-rabbitmq-performance-with-datadog/)

definition.content:
**RabbitMQ**

This dashboard provides an overview of your RabbitMQ (Management Plugin) environment. It monitors node status, provides information on message statuses, and gives you insight into various other observability measures of your RMQ setup.

*Note:* If you are using the Prometheus plugin version of RabbitMQ, please use the alternate dashboard.
Alarm tables summarize which nodes have active disk or memory alarms.
Average resource utilization by node is shown below. Assign the variable *rabbitmq_node* to see the resource usage of specific nodes.

definition.title: Running Nodes (value of 1 == running, 0 == not running)

definition.content: Health of your queues is shown below. Assign the variable *rabbitmq_queue* to see health metrics of a specific queue. Instrument your producers and consumers with [Data Streams Monitoring](https://docs.datadoghq.com/data_streams/setup/technologies/rabbitmq/?referrer=rabbitmq_management) to view your streaming topology and gain insight into the health of your pipelines.

definition.title: Queue Consumers' Ability to Take New Messages

definition.content: Get insights into your queues' producers and consumers by instrumenting them with Data Streams Monitoring. [Learn more](https://docs.datadoghq.com/data_streams/setup/technologies/rabbitmq/?referrer=rabbitmq_management)

definition.title: Top 10 Max Time in Queue by env

queries.name: query1
queries.query: max:data_streams.latency{type:rabbitmq AND pathway_type:edge AND direction:in AND (topic:$rabbitmq_queue.value)} by {topic,env}

definition.title: Incoming Messages by env, Producing Service

queries.name: upstream_services_throughput
queries.query: count(v: v>=0):data_streams.latency{type:rabbitmq AND direction:in AND pathway_type:edge AND (topic:$rabbitmq_queue.value)} by {start,env}.as_rate()

definition.title: Outgoing Messages by env, Consuming Service

queries.name: downstream_services_throughput_by_queues
queries.query: count(v: v>=0):data_streams.latency{type:rabbitmq AND direction:in AND pathway_type:full AND (topic:$rabbitmq_queue.value)} by {service,env}.as_rate().rollup(10)

definition.title: Top 10 p95 Message Size by env

definition.content: Assign the variable *rabbitmq_exchange* to view information of specific exchanges.
